intro: Euphrasia tatarica var. simplex, commonly known as the Tatarian eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
